lead_paragraph: Since taking power six years ago, Afghanistan's fundamentalist Taliban movement has brought a whirlwind of destruction. Now it is waging war on the country's cultural heritage, blowing up treasured statues from Afghanistan's pre-Islamic past. These include two monumental Buddhas carved from rock cliffs 14 centuries ago. Since plans for the demolition were announced Monday, anguished protests have poured in from around the world, including the three Islamic countries that alone recognize the Taliban -- Pakistan, Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates. Iran correctly reminded the Taliban that Islam does not preach the destruction of objects sacred to other religions and cultures. Last night the U.N. issued an urgent plea to spare the two giant Buddhas.
abstract: Editorial scores Taliban's destruction of two giant Buddhas, treasured statues from Afghanistan's pre-Islamic cultural past (S)
